Articles.Content:
Hi everyone,

I have no idea if science will be reworked entirely in KSP 2 or if it will be similar. However, in KSP 1 i always thought that some science reports are quite repetetive (e.g. pressure). Now i can totally understand that inventing creative science reports for tons of situations is a lot of work, so...

Why not outsource this to the community.

Lets say player A is in Kerbin orbit at lets say 314 159 m. He makes a science report and thinks: "Hmm i have a good idea for a science report text." Then he writes a science report... e.g. something like "We made an outstanding discovery, the pressure at this attitude shows an anomality to the barometric height formular. First speculations link this anomaly to a recent dessert accident involving Jeb and Valentina." Now i am thinking about some like/dislike functinality so player B is in a similar situation and gets a random science report, i.e. the one from player A. He reads the text from player A thinks nice or not nice, and likes or dislikes it. Player C does not want to read player generated content, so he turns it off.

Any opinions?
